byline.contributor: Merna Thomas contributed reporting from Cairo, and Kareem Fahim from Sharm el Sheikh, Egypt.

abstract: Egyptian Pres Abdel Fattah el-Sisi reassures residents of resort town Sharm el Sheikh after Russian charter jet crashes and contends with international criticisms for avoiding crisis; countries cancel flights to resort area in response while Islamic State militant group from Egypt takes credit for crash.
lead_paragraph: Faced with skepticism after a Russian plane crash in Sinai and flooding in Alexandria, Egyptian officials portray Western alarms of terrorism as a plot against Egypt.

headline.main: Egyptian Leaders Blame a Familiar Foe, Conspiracy, but Citizens Are Dubious
headline.print_headline: Egypt Leans On a Familiar Foe: Conspiracy

snippet: Faced with skepticism after a Russian plane crash in Sinai and flooding in Alexandria, Egyptian officials portray Western alarms of terrorism as a plot against Egypt.
